thread.title: Massachusetts native among missing mariners - Massachusetts news
thread.title_full: Massachusetts native among missing mariners - Massachusetts news

author: boston.com
title: Massachusetts native among missing mariners - Massachusetts news
text:
BOSTON (AP) — A Massachusetts native and graduate of the Massachusetts Maritime Academy is among crew members missing from U.S. cargo ship that sank near the Bahamas after encountering heavy seas from Hurricane Joaquin.
A spokesman for the college confirmed Monday that 2005 graduate Keith Griffin, originally from Winthrop, was an engineer on the El Faro.
 College President Rear Adm. Francis McDonald said in a statement that ‘‘our thoughts and prayers go out to Keith’s family and to the families of all the mariners on board.’’
The El Faro departed from Jacksonville, Florida, on Sept. 29, when Joaquin was still a tropical storm. The ship had 33 crew members, and it was heading to Puerto Rico on a regular cargo supply run when it ran into trouble. Contact was lost early Thursday.
